result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Erickson #17704 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark A Erickson #17704 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark A Erickson #17704 was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served in the amount of 190 days.
Concurrent with: 09CF13 and 11CF80

superMiscConds.notes:
The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
Def to have NO contact w/Kayla Harris.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
Def placed on a pymt plan of $50/mo beginning 5/21/16

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Def to have NO contact w/Kayla Harris.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

Regarding Sentence Credit

Defendant Mark A Erickson #17704 appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Mark T. Fuhr appeared by telephone for State of Wisconsin. In this case court ordered a prison sentence IS, probation was revoked, ct over confident that he would successfully complete probation, the Court did not mention eligibility and didnt order CS or CC to any other sentence. Ct asks def if serving sentence other than sentence in 14CF10 or 09CF13. Def says he has not gotten a response from DOC. Ct believes this is a continuance of the sentencing hearing, Ct gives right to appr in person. Def believes can be taken care of over the phone. further comments on sentencing/credit for time served. Agrees to appr by telephone for , right to be represented by atty-declines. Ct questions def, finds know/vol wiaves right to atty/waives right to appr in person. Spec pros Fuhr, state will be silent on CC/CS sentence and cts, could speak to other issues. 
9:14a 14CF10 Def comments on sentencing.

Defendant Mark A Erickson in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Mark Furh, special prosecutor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Furh handed to court Exhibit 1 and 2 to Court - no objection - both exhibits are admitted.  Pre-Sentence Report referenced.  Willett requests independent pre-sentence report.  Willet requesting adjournment - 60 days out. Adult Drug Court discussed.  If he has interest needs to discuss with Anne Whiting/Drug Court Coordinator.  Fuhr here because McKnight represented defendant a few years back.  Fuhr  no position taken, would like to appear by phone at next hearing. Court grants the request for independant pre-sentence agreement.  Release on bail/bond provided good conduct and if probable cause bel violation, sentencing hearing may be moved up or bail revoked until sentenc hearing taking place.  Court grants Furh to appear by teleph.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.
